intro: Mikania corei, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its rapid growth and vine-like habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers that are typically blue or purple in color, blooming throughout the summer months. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and twining. Mikania corei is often found in moist, disturbed soils along stream banks and in woodland areas.
